definition: To reduce in amount, degree, or severity.
Deviating from what is normal or expected.
To choose not to do something.
To make something impure or weaker by adding inferior elements.
To speak in favor of something.
Concerned with the appreciation of beauty.
To increase in power, influence, and reputation.
To make more bearable.
To combine or mix together.
Open to more than one interpretation; unclear.
Having mixed or opposing feelings at the same time.
Something out of place in time.
Comparable or similar in some way.
Something that is unusual or unexpected.
A strong feeling of dislike or aversion.
Lack of interest or emotion.
Difficult and requiring a lot of effort.
Able to speak clearly and expressively.
To make something unpleasant less severe.
To reduce in force or degree; to weaken.
Fearless and daring.
Severe or stern in appearance; undecorated.
So lacking in originality as to be obvious and boring.
To support or strengthen.
Pompous in speech and manner.
A harsh, jarring noise.
Given to sudden changes of mood or behavior.
To punish or criticize harshly.
Something that brings about a change in something else.
Sarcastic in a scathing and bitter way; or able to burn or corrode.
Deception by means of trickery or subterfuge.
Convincing and well reasoned.
To accept or allow behavior that is considered morally wrong or offensive.
Complex and difficult to follow.
To confirm or support with evidence.
Too trusting; gullible.
Appropriateness of behavior or conduct; propriety.
Respect and esteem due to a superior or elder.
To mock or ridicule.
To dry out thoroughly.
Lacking a plan, purpose, or enthusiasm.
A bitter and abusive speech or piece of writing.
Lacking self-confidence; shy and reserved.
Tending to delay or procrastinate.
A funeral hymn or mournful speech.
To free someone from a mistaken belief.
To perceive or recognize clearly.
Fundamentally different or distinct in quality or kind.
To scatter or spread widely.
A firmly held opinion, often a religious belief.
